channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2023080050
item.description:
Report E-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Four drums of Morpholine (UN2054) were the only cargo left during the unloading process of a trailer. An odor was detected, therefore, a contractor was requested on site for further assessment of the situation. It was discovered that two of the four drums had potentially released approximately one-gallon of product onto the trailer floor throughout transit. The cause is likely corrosion identified at the bottom of the two drums. The drums were overpacked by the contractor.

item.description:
Report X-2023080041

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS FOUND LEAKING WHEN IT GOT TO THE OUTBOUND TRAILER. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2023070997
item.description:
Report E-2023070997

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: OSBORNE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 1, 2023, at 1654 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Osborne, Kansas regarding the release of approximately 1065 gallons of WGS2035 Gas Sweetener (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (methanol), UN1993, 3, III) from (4) 330-gallon poly totes, reportedly due to a rollover vehicle accident and was contained to a 100' x 15' area of soil shoulder of the road. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized and staged offsite at the Kansas DOT salvage yard for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080227
item.description:
Report X-2023080227

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While the pacakge was in the IC belt, this one fell off. the manager called QA immediately. DescribePack: One bottle got broken and spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA wet to the area with a red tote line with a hazmat bag, we cleaned the area and brought the pacakge to eh processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2023080145
item.description:
Report X-2023080145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN DROPPED ON THE TOP CORNER CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT AND SOIL THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

Report X-2023070551

item.title: Report X-2023070529
item.description:
Report X-2023070529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR RADIOED IN A HAZMAT LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE SPILL. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROPERLY CLEAN UP THE SPILL. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING APPRIOATE PROCEDURES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL

item.title: Report X-2023070489
item.description:
Report X-2023070489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR RADIOED INTO DMP FOR A LEAEKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT SPILL AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO HANDLE THE SPILL. FOLLOWING RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023070488
item.description:
Report X-2023070488

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKING HAZMAT TO THE DMP. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. AT ARRIVAL RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON WHAT STEPS TO TAKE FOR CLEAN UP. FOLLOWING PROPER CLEAN UP PROCEDURE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT BACK LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023070401
item.description:
Report X-2023070401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE NEXT TO THE IRREG BELT WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THE TWO OF FOUR 1 GALLON BOTTLES CAPS WERE LOOSE. THE LEAKING BOTTLES LEAKED ON THE OTHER TWO BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.
